Package kalix.javasdk.timer

Interface TimerScheduler

  • public interface TimerScheduler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<akka.Done> cancel​(String name)
      Cancel an existing timer.
      <I,​O>
      java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<akka.Done>      		 startSingleTimer​(String name, java.time.Duration delay, DeferredCall<I,​O> deferredCall)
      Schedule a single timer in Kalix.

    • Method Detail

      • startSingleTimer

        <I,​O> java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<akka.Done> startSingleTimer​(String name,
                                                                             java.time.Duration delay,
                                                                             DeferredCall<I,​O> deferredCall)
        Schedule a single timer in Kalix. Timers allow for scheduling calls in the future. For example, to verify that some process have been completed or not.

        Timers are persisted and are guaranteed to run at least once.

        When a timer is triggered, the scheduled call is executed. If successfully executed, the timer completes and is automatically removed. In case of a failure, the timer is rescheduled with a delay of 3 seconds. This process repeats until the call succeeds. Therefore, timers run at least once.

        Each timer has a `name` and if a new timer with same `name` is registered the previous is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        name - unique name for the timer
        delay - delay, starting from now, in which the timer should be triggered
        deferredCall - a call to component that will be executed when the timer is triggered

      • cancel

        java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<akka.Done> cancel​(String name)
        Cancel an existing timer. This completes successfully if not timer is registered for the passed name.
